events.title: IBS & CBE Symposium "Prayers for the World"
events.description: This workshop, presented by Rev. Dr. David Mastsumoto, Rev. Dr. Mutsumo Fujiwara Wondra, and Rev. Dr. Takashi Miyaji, is baout how the teaching and life values of Jodo Shinshu guide us in the pursuit of World Peace.

events.title: Ministerial Affairs Committee: Ministers' Retirement & Benefits
Northwest District Conevention Check-In / Registration
events.description: Please come check-in and get your name tag, program booklet, goodie bag, and sign up for banquet seating.  Seattle Betsuin Buddhist Temple welcomes you to the 73rd Annual Northwest District Buddhist Convention and Buddhist Churches of America National Council Meeting.

events.title: Morning Service
events.description: Dharma Talk: Rev. Kory Quon, Special Presentation: Rev. Kiyonobu Kuwahara

events.title: Shin Buddhist Liberation Theology & Hansen's Disease (Leprosy) Activism in Japan
events.description:
Professor Starling will be presenting some of her recent book on traditional temple wives in Japan and the roles that they play in temple life. She will also cover some of her current project concerning social engagement being led by Buddhist women highlighting the work of national and transnational groups who have taken up the cause of leprosy awareness.
 Ficilitator - Joseph Gotchy

events.title: Sing Namo Amida Butsu
events.description:
Kemi will be presenting the new Gatha book project that was completed earlier this year. She will be presenting a few specific songs and having the group sing and practice some of the songs that will likely be part of the convention programming. Session details will be left to her discretion. Please go to the "News" Section of the App to access the Link for this session.
 Facilitator - Dennis Yamashita

events.title: EcoSangha and Earth Dana
events.description: Rev. Castro will be presenting on the SBBT’s EcoSangha program and some of the successes that they have seen since being formed. He will also cover the concept of EcoSangha and some ideas of what could be considered "Earth Dana".

events.title: Temple Dana and Giving Back
events.description: The Seattle Betsuin Youth Adult Minister Assistants will be leading a youth discussion on Dana and Buddhism.

events.title: World Peace Begins with Me
events.description: In this workshop we will explore ways we can strengthen our efforts to make the world around us a happier, healthier more joyous place.

events.title: Seattle Betsuin Minister and Assistants Dana Dharmathon
events.description: Seattle Betsuin Reverend Irene Goto and Minister Assistants Leonnora Clarke, Maya Stout, and Devon Matsumoto will each give a Dharama talk relating to our theme of "Dana for World Peace"

events.title: Otera de Asobo, Let’s Play at Temple!
events.description: People in the temple’s have become more familiar with Ayano’s youth playgroup. Along with Kaori, they will be presenting some of the successes of the temple playgroup, showing adults what kind of activities they do and trying to inspire others to start planting the seeds of the Dharma in our children and what benefits that brings to temples.

events.title: 「お聲明からの学び」Oshomyo karano manabi (Learning from Chanting)
events.description:
This workshop is a chanting workshop.
 Facilitator - Junko Nakano

events.title: YBA: Bits of Rubble Turned to Gold
events.description: An interactive workshop where attendees will be given the opportunity to craft something under the guidance of Rev. Fred Pelger.

events.title: Sing Namo Amida Butsu (Second Session)
events.description:
Kemi will be presenting the new Gatha book project that was completed earlier this year. She will be presenting a few specific songs and having the group sing and practice some of the songs that will likely be part of the convention programming. Session details will be left to her discretion. Please go to the "News" Section of the App to access the Link for this session.
 Facilitator - Dennis Yamashita

events.title: Buddhist Parenting Panel
events.description: This session, lead by Reverend Diana Thompson Tri-State Buddhist Temple and Reverend Yuki Sugahara Oregon Buddhist Temple, will be a look into the lives of ministers and laypeople who have raised their children in various Buddhist environments and with children of different ages. What Buddhist principles have they found helpful, how have they introduced Buddhism into their children’s lives and what kind of results has that led to?

events.title: D. T. Suzuki (1870-1966) and the Remaking of Pure Land Buddhism
events.description:
Pure Land Buddhism as we know it today is in many ways the result a crisis and redefinition of Buddhism during the nineteenth and early twentieth century. A major figure in this redefinition was the scholar and thinker Daisetz Suzuki, who is perhaps best known today as a proponent of Zen in the West. But he also had a deep interest in Pure Land Buddhism. This talk explores the life and thought of Suzuki and his innovative interpretations of Pure Land Buddhism.
 Facilitator - Leonora Clarke

events.title: Archiving Temple History
events.description:
Tom Ikeda will be presenting on what Densho does as an organization. Why is it so important to record and retain our historical records? What stories do they tell and what mistakes can we avoid by remembering our past.
 Facilitator - Alan Hoshino

events.title: Jodo Shinshu Rituals - Melodic Chanting of the Juseige
events.description:
Rev. Sekiya will be presenting a workshop on chanting the Juseige.
 Facilitator - Shizue Yahata

events.title: Nihongo Dharmathon
events.description:
Rev. Watanabe, Rev. Fujita, and Rev. Mukojima will each present a Dharma talk that relates to the theme of "Dana for World Peace"
 Facilitator - Rev. Katsuya

events.title: Panel on Roads to Tokudo
events.description:
This session, presented by Rev. Furumoto, Rev. Nakata, and MA Melissa Opel, will be a look into the lives of certified ministers prior to deciding to become ordained. What drove them to want to be ministers, what were they doing before, what were their motivations. Some of what their path into ministry looked like. Session name may be adjusted later.
 Facilitaor - Jason Yokoyama

events.title: Dana for World Peace
events.description:
In this combined session, lead by Rev. Miyagi, we will be exploring how we, as Buddhist’s, can have an impact on the issues that we face every day individually and as a whole. What are we doing now and how should we continue to move forward in the face of strife and adversity. This session will be interactive as we gather opinions from the audience and share our ideas.
Please download the NW District Convention App prior to this session available in the iTunes and Android app stores for free.

Please go to the "News" section of the app to find a link to the interactive part of this session.

 Facilitaor - Professor Erik Hammerstrom
